Do powerowl batteries (1.2V) in comparison with alkaline batteries (1.5V) work in every battery based appliance? Appliances are designed to work within the voltage range of 1.5V to 0.9V. Although the initial voltage of Ni-MH rechargeable batteries is around 1.2V, they are capable of maintaining a steady discharge level for as long as they hold capacity Can I use a different brand charger for my powerowl batteries? We always recommend an powerowl charger. Most of the other manufacturers’ chargers will also be able to charge your batteries, but batteries may not be able to reach top performance Do batteries come with leak-proof protection? Why do some people encounter battery leakage? Powerowl batteries are designed to be leak-proof. Overcharging is the main cause of battery leakage. When selecting a charger, it is crucial to choose one that will automatically cut off power once the battery is fully charged.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 5, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great rechargeable batteries at a great price
reviews.reviewText: Got these batteries to replace all my remote controlled devices, so far these batteries are delivering… they came with just a 25% charge; fully charged them and installed them on my devices… 5 months later, no issues. Extremely happy with them!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 21, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great customer service
reviews.reviewText: I got some AA and AAA and had some issue charging the batteries, some of the batteries wouldn't fully charge and got really hot. I contacted the company and they reached out to me very quick. After some investigation, they were able to determine that my charger isn't compatible with the batteries, so they shipped out the replacement batteries and gave me a free charger too. Can't ask for more than that.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 4, 2024
reviews.reviewText: Ordered 2 (two) packs, charge me shipping for each individual package??? Product excellent, Charges well. Holds charge I personally know for 5 weeks-- charger showed 99% after 5 weeks ...be careful to watch OR pay attention to his shipping procedure, Or email him first to let him know/understand he can put both packages in same mailing box??HMMMM...

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 23, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars Doesn't deliver 1100 mAh compared to alkaline aaa battery
reviews.reviewText: These rechargeable AAA batteries are labeled as having 1100 mAh of energy. AAA alkaline batteries are said to contain 1000 to 1100 mAh. These rechargeables simply do not last as long in a high-drain environment. My use is an indoor-outdoor thermometer where the outdoor sensor transmits the temperature wirelessly to the receiver-display unit indoors. Leading brand AAA alkaline batteries last for 5 to 6 weeks in the outdoor transmitter. These rechargeable AAA batteries lasted for a little less than 3 weeks, so half as long.They cost 2.5 to 3 times as much (per battery) as AAA alkaline batteries. The secret about AAA alkaline batteries is they are indeed rechargeable! Just use a recharger that has a plastic door or closed enclosure where the batteries sit. I have found alkaline batteries to be usefully rechargeable on average three times; after that they either start a small leak of their contents or they do not take a good charge (according to my cheap battery tester). Sometimes alkaline batteries leak in use without ever undergoing a recharging; this seems common in remote controls (ugh). In high drain applications recharged AAA batteries last half as long as new batteries. In low drain applications (such as a wireless mouse) they last a long time, whatever that is.The one advantage of these NiMH batteries have over alkaline batteries is NiMH batteries don't start leaking for several years and after dozens of charges. A big disadvantage of NiMH batteries is that when not used they rarely keep a good charge for longer than 3 months; as they age this time falls to 1 month.So it's a complex situation. I hate leaky alkaline batteries, such as the house brand batteries I get at a very big box store. I hate batteries that go dead while being stored, such as NiMH batteries. 3 stars to all concerned.
We’re focusing on using rechargeable batteries around the house

reviews.reviewTitle: Capacities rated at 2400mAh (~85% advertised) max in a group of 16 cells.
reviews.reviewText: Batteries were tested using Zanflare C4 battery tester.Capacities between 2200mAh to 2400mAh (85% advertised)... not super impressed.Voltages and temps were normal.Overall usable but nothing to really jump at. Have to test for longer to know if they really last.
These batteries are awesome, they are the only brand I use and own. HIGHLY RECOMMEND!!!!
